intro: Thrixspermum sutepense, commonly known as the Sutepense thrixspermum, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Thrixspermum sutepense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
